meanings.sent1: She imbittered her tea by adding too much sugar.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words imbittered their friendship.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk imbittered his morning cereal.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal imbittered his view of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine imbittered his entire day.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel bitter or resentful
meanings.sent1: His constant criticism imbittered her towards him.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment imbittered the employees.
meanings.sent3: The lost game imbittered the team's mood.
meanings.sent4: The broken promise imbittered her trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The cold response imbittered his feelings towards her.
